channel.title: NCAA on Jetson's Sports Data Blog
channel.description: Recent content in NCAA on Jetson's Sports Data Blog

item.title: What Defines a Kevin Willard Team?
item.description: The Kevin Willard Era has started in College Park. After a long awaited changing of the guard for the Terrapins, what can fans expect from the new head coach during his time at Xfinity? Today we are looking at game logs from NCAA Basketball games since 2011-12. library(tidyverse) library(ggbeeswarm) library(ggrepel) logs <- read_csv("https://dwillis.github.io/sports-data-files/logs1222.csv") logs ## # A tibble: 122,275 × 48 ## Season Game Date TeamF…¹ Oppon…² HomeA…³ W_L TeamS…⁴ Oppon…⁵ TeamFG ## <chr> <dbl> <date> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <dbl> ## 1 2011-2… 1 2011-11-11 Air Fo… Army <NA> W 87 71 29 ## 2 2011-2… 2 2011-11-12 Air Fo… VMI N W 75 65 28 ## 3 2011-2… 3 2011-11-18 Air Fo… Wester… <NA> W 65 37 24 ## 4 2011-2… 4 2011-11-23 Air Fo… Colora… <NA> L (1… 73 76 25 ## 5 2011-2… 5 2011-12-03 Air Fo… Drake @ L 60 62 16 ## 6 2011-2… 6 2011-12-07 Air Fo… Wright… <NA> W 55 34 19 ## 7 2011-2… 7 2011-12-10 Air Fo… Arkans… <NA> W 63 51 24 ## 8 2011-2… 8 2011-12-17 Air Fo… Maryla… <NA> W 64 60 22 ## 9 2011-2… 9 2011-12-22 Air Fo… Gonzaga @ L 60 70 22 ## 10 2011-2… 10 2011-12-29 Air Fo… Wagner N L 61 72 18 ## # … with 122,265 more rows, 38 more variables: TeamFGA <dbl>, TeamFGPCT <dbl>, ## # Team3P <dbl>, Team3PA <dbl>, Team3PPCT <dbl>, TeamFT <dbl>, TeamFTA <dbl>, ## # TeamFTPCT <dbl>, TeamOffRebounds <dbl>, TeamTotalRebounds <dbl>, ## # TeamAssists <dbl>, TeamSteals <dbl>, TeamBlocks <dbl>, TeamTurnovers <dbl>, ## # TeamPersonalFouls <dbl>, OpponentFG <dbl>, OpponentFGA <dbl>, ## # OpponentFGPCT <dbl>, Opponent3P <dbl>, Opponent3PA <dbl>, ## # Opponent3PPCT <dbl>, OpponentFT <dbl>, OpponentFTA <dbl>, … I want to make some beeswarm plots on some key metrics that can help us understand the coach’s profile and evolution over time.

item.title: Volleyball Aces
item.description: With Maryland Volleyball’s season entering the home stretch, Sydney Dowler leads the team in aces by 8. How does she stack up against her teammates and other players in the NCAA? library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.2 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(ggbeeswarm) library(ggrepel) set.

item.title: Maryland Football YPP
item.description: With 8 games complete in the 2022 college football season, we already have (or should have) a decent handle on where our favorite teams stand in the NCAA D1 universe. Texas A&M is not who many thought they were, while Syracuse and Kansas are among the teams that have exceeded expectations thus far. Today we’ll be looking at two measures of a team’s efficiency: Offensive/Defensive Yards per Play, and how they relate to a team’s wins that season.

item.title: CFB Recruiting Ratings & Wins
item.description: Today we’re analyzing recruiting rankings and seeing if they have any impact on winning in college football. Our intuition says… maybe? Let’s find out. We’ll load in tidyverse and our datasets with the team records by year and recruiting rankings. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.

item.title: First Play Interceptions
item.description: Today we are looking at incidences of interceptions that happend from the first play from scrimmage of a half. We will use college football play by play data to do this from the cfbfastR package. Connor Bazelak threw two at the beginning of each half on Saturday. We want to know just how rare that is. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.

item.title: Volleyball Waffle Chart
item.description: First we will load in our data from the GitHub URL. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.2 ── ## ✔ ggplot2 3.3.6 ✔ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✔ tibble 3.1.8 ✔ dplyr 1.0.9 ## ✔ tidyr 1.2.0 ✔ stringr 1.4.1 ## ✔ readr 2.1.2 ✔ forcats 0.5.2 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() logs <- read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/dwillis/NCAAWomensVolleyballData/main/data/ncaa_womens_volleyball_matchstats_2022.csv') ## Rows: 6077 Columns: 36 ## ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── ## Delimiter: "," ## chr (3): team, opponent, home_away ## dbl (31): team_score, opponent_score, s, kills, errors, total_attacks, hit_.

item.title: Big Ten CFB Avg Plays
item.description: Let’s take a look at some averages from the 2021-22 NCAA Football season. We want to look at average offensive plays per game from Big Ten teams. In order to do this, we will first load in the tidyverse library and pull the data as a csv from this url. Once we have the data, it will be stored in a variable called fblogs. library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.
